summary: This document is an email from August 10, 2019, forwarding information about the Bureau of Prisons' protocols for Suicide Watch and Psychology Observation. It appears to be a response to a request for information, likely related to the conditions of Jeffrey Epstein's detention prior to his death.

events.title: Email Forwarding Prison Protocols
events.description: An email was sent containing detailed protocols for Suicide Watch and Psychology Observation within the Bureau of Prisons.

keyFacts: The document details the strict protocols for inmates on Suicide Watch, including 24-hour monitoring, special smocks/blankets, and daily psychology checks.
It distinguishes Suicide Watch from Psychology Observation, where inmates are not deemed suicidal but have mental health concerns and retain more privileges.
The email date (August 10, 2019) is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and shortly before his death on August 10, 2019, suggesting it may be related to inquiries about his detention conditions.
